title: ISic020551. ISic020551
body:
1μ 𐅂´ΙΙΙΙ´ λε̄κυθίδες ΗΔΔ´

1Μ𐅂ΙΙΙΙΛΕ̄ΚΥΘΙΔΕΣΗΔΔ

Facsimile Images

Apparatus criticus

  • Text after Arena (IGASM 2)

English translation

Valentina Mignosa

One drachma and four obols: (price of) 120 lekythoi.

Italian translation

Valentina Mignosa

Una dracma e quattro oboli: (prezzo di) 120 lekythoi (transl. by Arena 2002).

commentary

Inscription in clear letters under the foot of an intact pelike, depicting a scene with Dionysus and a satyr. The first interpretation of the text is due to Halbherr (referred to by Orsi 1906), who interpreted λε̄κυθίδες as a measure followed by the number twenty ΔΔ (Orsi also reads this way, while Arena corrects with ΗΔΔ). Again according to Halbherr, the preceding number, indicated in accordance with the Attic system, should be read as 'ten thousand and one drachma and four obols'. Arena (see translation, which we accept) assumes a correspondence between the two values.

bibliography

  • Orsi 1906 368-370, fig. 272, pl. 16 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10002679
  • Arena 2002 81 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10001373
Licensed under a Creative Commons-Attribution 4.0 licence.
